3/3/2020.name: Teen Stress Today
3/3/2020.description:
Learn how to keep stress in check for the whole family.







 Teen Stress Today 
 Tuesday, March 3, 7:30-8:30 a.m., District 125 Administration Center 
Understanding and managing stress is a critical component of parenting. When parents are stressed, so are their children. This session will offer tips on keeping stress in check for the whole family.

3/3/2020.name: Band Concert
3/3/2020.description: Featuring Advanced Symphonic Band and Freshman Band

3/4/2020.name: Campaign Fair/Issues Forum
3/4/2020.description:
Campaign fair 6-6:45 p.m. 
Issues Forum 7-8 p.m.



The SHS Political Action Club is hosting its Campaign Fair from 6-6:45 p.m. Wednesday in the Patriot Lobby outside Room 2104. The fair is intended for first-time voters to meet with candidates and campaigns prior to the March 17 primary election.

After the Campaign Fair, the public is invited to attend the club's Issues Forum from 7-8 p.m. in Room 2104. Students will moderate a forum featuring two experts - former state Sen. Dan Biss and Ted Dabrowski, president of Wirepoints - speaking for and against the November referendum seeking to amend the Illinois Constitution to allow a graduated tax.

3/4/2020.name: Band Concert
3/4/2020.description: Featuring Concert Band, Symphonic Band and Honor Band

3/5/2020.name: Planning Ahead for Sophomore Families
3/5/2020.description:
College and career night for families. 
Students, bring your SHS iPad.
IEP/504 special session, 6:30-6:50, Room 6110



The College Career Center will hold its annual "Planning Your Future" night for sophomore families at 7 p.m. Thursday, March 5 in the Performing Arts Center. Postsecondary Counselors Sara English and Dan Miller, and Career Exploration Program Manager Diane Willock, will discuss:
 * What families can expect during their junior year as they embark on the college and career exploration process.
* Naviance, an online tool to assist Stevenson students with college planning.
* Career planning options, including internships, job shadowing, and more.
 
Students are strongly encouraged to attend with their parents or guardians. Families should bring their student's school-issued iPad and network login for an interactive experience. The counselors also request that students log in to Naviance before the meeting to update their password.

A special session for parents and guardians of students with IEP/504 plans will take place before the main presentation. The special session will run from 6:30-6:50 p.m. in Room 6110, which is located in the new East Building addition.

3/9/2020.name: ISA Testing - Juniors
3/9/2020.description:
Some students will be tested Monday and the others on Tuesday; some will take the exam in the morning and some in the afternoon. Students should check their SHS email for details.





All juniors will be taking the  Illinois Science Assessment  on Monday or Tuesday, March 9 or 10. Some students will be tested Monday and the others on Tuesday; some will take the exam in the morning and some in the afternoon. Students should check their SHS email for details. Juniors will use their Stevenson iPad for the exam, and need to do the following:
       	* Update the iPad operating system (OS) to 13.3.1.
  	* Remove the ISA 2019 app.
  	* Install the ISA 2020 app from the Self Service app, which is already installed on the iPad.
       
Juniors also will need to bring these for the exam, in addition to their iPad:
       	* Wired headphones that plug into the iPad if they want to use text-to-speech
  	* Their school ID
  	* Non-science reading materials in case they finish early
  	* Calculator ( following SAT guidelines )
       
Juniors should make sure their iPad has 100% power prior to taking the exam. Anyone needing help can visit the SMARTdesk (Room 3014 in the Link) before 4 p.m. Friday, March 6.

3/12/2020.name: ARTalk with Donna Hickman
3/12/2020.description:
Open to the public




Visiting Artist of the Month Donna Hickman, a former Stevenson art teacher, will discuss her work and her career during the fifth ARTalks presentation of the 2019-20 school year. ARTalks is sponsored by the Stevenson High School Foundation and the SHS Fine Arts Division. This year's theme is "Celebrating Women Artists." To see more of her work, visit  www.donnastewarthickman.com . 

The Visiting Artist Gallery is located on the first floor of the West Building, just south of the Forum (point) entrance. Use parking lot B for easiest access. ARTalks are free and open to the public.  Learn more about ARTalks and Stevenson's Visiting Artist of the Month program .

4/1/2020.name: Supporting Our Teens' Mental Health CANCELLED
4/1/2020.description:
This event has been cancelled.


Supporting Our Teens' Mental Health 
 Wednesday, April 1, 7-9 p.m., Vernon Area Public Library 


Get insights into how to help teens manage stress and anxiety in this moderated discussion with mental health experts including Promila Kumar of Sanjeevani, a nonprofit providing free advocacy, support, and guidance to people dealing with mental health problems; Mara Heichman, a certified professional coach; Dori Mages, licensed clinical social worker with North Shore Family Services; a counselor from Stevenson High School; and Vrushali Thakkar, Stevenson senior and mental health advocate. Co-sponsored by Stevenson High School.



This program is free and open to all. Registration is required.  Register online here , by telephone at 224-543-1485, or in person at any service desk in the library.
-->

4/14/2020.name: SAT Testing for Juniors/PSAT Testing for Sophomores
Doing the Right Thing
4/14/2020.description:
Parenting teens as they gain more freedom and independence.







 Doing the Right Thing: Supporting Responsible Decision-Making 
 Tuesday, April 14, 7:30-8:30 a.m., District 125 Administration Center 
During summer vacation, teens have more freedom and independence. This session will focus on how parents can help support responsible decision-making by their teens, especially those about to head off to college.

4/15/2020.name: Journey to the Center of a Teen's Brain
4/15/2020.description:
Part of our Parent Engagement Series







 Journey to the Center of a Teen's Brain 
 Wednesday, April 8, 7-9 p.m., Recital Hall 
Participants will hear about mental health in the schools and the impact of social media on brain development. Find out what anxiety, depression, ADHD and autism look like in the brain, and what can parents do with this knowledge.

5/11/2020.name: Co-Curricular Night for Incoming Freshmen
5/11/2020.description:
Meet and talk with coaches, club sponsors and students.





The Co-Curricular Fair will be held on Wednesday, March 18 from 6:30-8:30 p.m. in the Field House, which is just east of the Stadium (park in lot D or B). 

All incoming freshmen and their families are invited to come meet and talk with sport coaches, club sponsors and current Stevenson students involved in more than 35 sport teams, more than 140 co-curricular clubs and the many intramural programs. Take advantage of this opportunity to find out about all that Stevenson offers.
